Definition of intel from the Cambridge Advanced Learner 's Dictionary Thesaurus Cambridge University Press Examples of intel intel However, military veterans are taught to always be on the lookout for intel.
From Huffington Post We count on our thousands of readers to help us gather the latest intel.
From Dallas Morning News These examples are from the Cambridge English Corpus and from sources on the web.
Any opinions in the examples do not represent the opinion of the Cambridge Dictionary editors or of Cambridge University Press or its licensors.
More examples Fewer examples They're reading all the reports from gang intel and comparing them with official stats.
From New York Post We are not leaving town until we restore the intel cuts.
From The Hill Every day this week, we'll give you little intel on one of the nominees.
From NPR You need to talk to the intel community.
From The Atlantic Intel's booth had live demonstration of new way of looking at photo collections or web sites.
From VentureBeat But top policymakers ignored the intel even firing folks who had the temerity to tell the truth.
From Foreign Policy Many in our own intel community knew he was bad guy, affiliated with bad guys, not good ally.
From Foreign Policy He initially said he would be meeting with high-level intel briefers mid- week but that it was delayed.
From NBCNews.com It's about the team, or the helicopter pilots, or the intel folks that teed this whole thing up.
From CBS News They also get you enemy intel that helps you target enemy forces better.
From VentureBeat Our evaluations out of the intel community informed us about where the reality was, what the market would bear.
From The Atlantic don't want to be amplifying bad intel.
From The Atlantic If anyone had hang-ups about revealing their hard-earned intel to potential competitors, they weren't talking.
